meanings.definition: To exert force on (someone or something) so as to cause movement towards oneself.
meanings.sent1: She pulls the door open to go outside.
meanings.sent2: He pulls the wagon up the hill.
meanings.sent3: The cat pulls the string, trying to catch the toy at the end.
meanings.sent4: The magnet pulls the metal paperclips towards it.
meanings.sent5: The strong wind pulls the leaves off the tree branches.

meanings.definition: To draw or haul towards oneself or itself, in a particular direction, or into a particular position.
meanings.sent1: I pull the curtains closed before going to bed.
meanings.sent2: The fisherman pulls the net out of the water.
meanings.sent3: The child pulls the blanket over their head to hide.
meanings.sent4: The tractor pulls the heavy load behind it effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The gardener pulls the weeds out of the flower bed.

meanings.definition: A force drawing something in a particular direction.
meanings.sent1: The strong pull of the magnet attracts the metal objects.
meanings.sent2: The gravitational pull of the Earth keeps us grounded.
meanings.sent3: The magnetic pull of the north pole affects compass needles.
meanings.sent4: The irresistible pull of the ocean waves draws surfers in.
meanings.sent5: The magnetic pull of the fridge keeps the door closed.
